page.title: 03Daily Routine.
page.content:
Most mornings I am woken up at 7 O'clock by my brother's radio alarm. I lie in bed listening to it until 7-15 and then I rush to have a wash and get dressed so I can see the cartoons on TV-AM at 7-25. All the family eat breakfast together and then I read the newspaper called 'The Sun'. I like the sports pages best. I leave the house at 8-30 and walk to school through the park. It takes me about 12 minutes to reach school but I can do it much faster if it is raining. School lasts from 9-00 until 3-30 and I think it is great. I walk home after school with my brother. I don't go with him because he makes me late. I watch children's television and after tea I read for a while because my Dad makes me. I go to bed at 9-00.
Dharmendra Mistry. Age 10. Hurst Knoll
